artists.name: Layla Alamillo (she/they)
artists.description: I’m Layla Alamillo. I’m a paper artist and book designer based in Northeast Los Angeles. I create work inspired by the things I know well and observe in my everyday surroundings. Drawing from familiar landscapes, objects, and moments, I transform these details into tactile pieces of art.

artworks.title: Lantern (2022)
artworks.details: Medium: Paper. Large scale folded paper lanterns with light source.

artworks.title: Building 13 (2024)
artworks.details: Medium: Various paper bound together by thread. An assemblage of paper - a visual love letter to Building 13.

artists.name: Jennica Cabral (she/her)
artists.description: Hello, I’m Jennica Cabral, a Mexican-American digital artist. I like to use my experiences to influence and be expressed in my art. My experiences branch from illustrations to photography, to logo and graphic design. I have used my enthusiasm for art and design to build a strong work ethic and skills. Trained in Adobe Creative Suite and have a great understanding of creative design principles. I am constantly inspired by the world around me and bringing that to life through my illustrations.

artworks.title: Mug Cafe (2024)
artworks.details: Medium: Digital. A mug being used as a cafe with outside seating made of thimbles and bobbins

artworks.title: Book Tent (2024)
artworks.details: Medium: Digital. A book being used as a tent for a cat with pencils stacked on the side like logs of wood and pencil shavings used for the fire.

artworks.title: Can Apartment (2024)
artworks.details: Medium: Digital. a tall can being used as an apartment complex adorned with plants growing out of the top and draping along the sides along with a store front opening and potted plants at the base.

artists.name: Jenna DoQui (she/her)
artists.description: I'm Jenna, a multimedia artist. I use my unique spatial awareness from studying landscape architecture to create my pieces. My art is a warm and nostalgic exploration of landscapes at different scales. It is rich in color and contrast, exploring form and movement through illustrations found in scientific journals, mixed with the playfulness of late 20th-century album art. Each piece offers a microscopic view of an imagined world.

artworks.title: The blue lagoon (2024)
artworks.details: Medium: cyanotype ink and digital painting on archival paper

artworks.title: Glimmer (2024)
artworks.details: Medium: digital painting, ink and colored pencil on archival paper

artworks.title: Apple (2024)
artworks.details: Medium: cyanotype ink, apples, and digital drawing on archival paper

artists.name: Ross Gomez (he/they)
artists.description: Hi, I'm Ross!! I'm a queer, trans, Latine multimedia explorer, from the CA high desert. My interests include printmaking, painting, illustration, and finding new mediums for my work. My biggest inspirations for creating have always been drawn from the materials I use, the need for expression, and ideas about perception.

artworks.title: Flag (2023)
artworks.details: Medium: Block printed on sewn cotton fabric, hung by a chain. I bring symbolism of my trans experience into this piece: breaking the old self, healing, discovery, and comfort in the real identity (scissors, bandaids, and a heart shaped trans symbol that make up the stripes). This flag pattern was made by carving erasers and using fabric ink to stamp the cotton, ensuring long term durability. Front and center is a unifying piece, here representing a reminder that trans rights are still being fought for. The depiction of a weapon at rest but ready to be used if needed. The full piece is sewn by hand and machine, with the chain element added last for hanging/display.

artworks.title: Crunchy Hands Doodle no. 6 (2024)
artworks.details: Medium: paint marker on paper. These illustrations are part of an ongoing series of self portraits focused on exploring style, body language, self perception, and commitment to maintaining a steady comfort with low risk creation. The core of this series is the fact that the majority of them are carried with me everywhere in my sketchbook, and I add to them wherever and whenever I can.

artworks.title: Crunchy Hands Doodle no. 8 (2024)
artworks.details: Medium: paint marker on canvas panel. These illustrations are part of an ongoing series of self portraits focused on exploring style, body language, self perception, and commitment to maintaining a steady comfort with low risk creation. The core of this series is the fact that the majority of them are carried with me everywhere in my sketchbook, and I add to them wherever and whenever I can.

artists.name: Hui Ying (Caitlin Hoey) (she/her)
artists.description: Hui Ying is a Chinese-born adoptee based in East LA. Hui Ying has been painting since 2008 and completed her BFA at the University of Hartford, Connecticut. Through her oil paintings, she explores her identity through painting, and illustrating local spots she draws inspiration from both her adopted family's culture and her heritage. Through this series, she blends 17th-century European Baroque art with site-specific locations from her travels.

artworks.title: Somewhere: In Mercado De San Miguel (The Fisherman)
